p: It is well documented that the cytotoxic potential of extracts from A. muricata may be related to the copious occurrence of annonaceous acetogenins in various plant organs. These polyketide-derived acetogenins are documented to be selectively lethal to cancer cells which act by obstructing the mitochondrial complex I leading to ATP starvation in cancer cells which have greater ATP demand unlike normal cells [ 29, 33].
